DOC.brief_summary: The primary purpose study evaluate effect Mindfulness Based Cognitive Therapy ( MBCT ) v . Treatment Usual ( TAU ) depression anxiety symptom breast cancer patient recovery . Investigators examine whether MBCT-related improvement sleep quality , illness-related distress , rumination ( escalate cycle negative thinking ) predict MBCT-related decrease depression anxiety symptom ( Aim 2 ) . Exploratory analysis examine whether demographic ( e.g. , age , sex , race/ethnicity ) , individual difference ( e.g. , perceive stress , social support ) , clinical characteristic ( e.g. , stage/severity diagnosis ) , treatment adherence ( e.g. , session attend , hour weekly practice ) help determine MBCT effective ( Aim 3 ) .
DOC.criteria: Age 18 Able speak read English Diagnosis breast cancer ( stage ) active treatment ( e.g. , surgery , chemotherapy , and/or radiotherapy ) complete within 2 month 2 year Cognitive impairment mental illness would impair ability provide consent participate program ; Major psychiatric disorder ( e.g. , psychosis , personality disorder ) Current suicidal ideation suicide attempt within past 3 month Past participation MBCT group
